description: Nikola Petrak meets discreetly with trusted neighborhood leaders, presenting evidence from his briefcase and discussing the urgent need for citizen-led oversight as the BCI's failures worsen.

After a final Council meeting erupts in chaos, Nikola Petrak writes and delivers a formal handover order on paper, transferring all civic authority—including oversight of the failing BCI—to neighborhood assemblies.
Neighborhood assemblies across Stenograd receive the official directive, immediately organizing public tribunals and suspending all BCI-based enforcement.

Tribunals convene in city squares, where Council members give testimony before assembled crowds. Confessions reveal how BCI data was abused and how disappearances were authorized after Halden's death.
Verdicts are delivered: some former Council members are exiled or imprisoned, while others are offered reconciliation. Stenograd transitions fully to neighborhood-led governance, closing the BCI era.
